page.title: 01DEEPCAR & WORTLEY, S.YORKS.
page.content: { DEEPCAR}township is sited near the confluence of the Rivers Don and Porter ('Carr'=marsh). It has strong links with neighbouring{Stocksbridge (Total pop. approx. 14000) but is still remote from{Sheffield}(8 miles S.E.) although administered by it. Its character has changed from a small agricultural, then industrial, hamlet to an expanding dormitory township for commuters. However some families have lived there for several generations thus retaining a village atmosphere. The advent of a new bypass will relieve it of its heavy traffic. The bypass will intrude however into the tranquil and historical environ- ment of the small{WHARNCLIFFE}farming community. The farms, woods and Estate park-land are close to the old village of{Wortley.}This area is under the administration of{Barnsley}(6 ml.N.E.)
